required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multi-omics Research of Idopathic Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus (iNPH)
clinical_study.official_title: Multi-omics Research of Prognostic Factors of Ventriculoperitoneal Shunt for Idopathic Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: The research is designed to study the prognostic factors of ventriculoperitoneal (VP) shunt for iNPH by multi-omics research

detailed_description.textblock:
Preoperative T1-MRI, functional MRI and diffusion MRI imaging data of iNPH patients were collected. The clinical assessment was performed before/after the lumbar puncture test and 6 months after VP shunt. Clinical assessment included Mini-mental State Examination (MMSE), gait scores, Kiefer score, and Modified Rankin Scale (mRS). The cerebrospinal fluid was collected by tap-test, and 6 months after surgery by puncturing in the VP device pump.
Methods- The primary methods used are:
1. The cerebrospinal fluid proteomic analysis of iNPH patients before and after VP shunt surgery.
2. The structral and functional MRI analysis of iNPH patients
3. The clinical assessment of MMSE, gait scores, Kiefer score, and mRS. Objective- To study the prognostic factors of VP shunt for iNPH.

primary_outcome.measure: Proteomic pattern of CSF in iNPH patients
primary_outcome.description: Comparing the proteomic pattern differences in CSF between iNPH patients and normal age-matched normal volunteers by the analysis of mass spectrometry. Also, the responsive and non-responsive iNPH patients proteomic pattern were analzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Proteomic pattern changes of CSF in iNPH patients after VP shunt
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline (ventricular CSF) at 6 months after VP shunt
primary_outcome.description: Comparing the proteomic pattern differences in CSF of iNPH patients before surgery and after VP shunt by the analysis of mass spectrometry. Also, the responsive and non-responsive iNPH patients proteomic pattern were analzed.

secondary_outcome.description: Using automatic cortical and subcortical segmentation from the 3-dimensional T1weighted images to measure gray matter density in iNPH patients before surgery compared with healthy individual group. Also, the responsive and non-responsive iNPH patients structral MRI were analzed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the resting state fMRI
secondary_outcome.description: Change of BOLD singal intensity in the resting state fMRI in iNPH patients compared with normal healthy group. Also, the responsive and non-responsive iNPH patients functional MRI were analzed.

Franctional anisotropy, mean diffusivity and apparent diffusion coefficient were measured by diffusion MRI in region of interest of iNPH patients compared with normal healthy group. Also, the responsive and non-responsive iNPH patients diffusion MRI were analzed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 6 months after VP shunt
secondary_outcome.description: A score for iNPH severity; range 0-26; higher indicates higher severity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 6 months after VP shunt
secondary_outcome.description: A score for cognitive ability; range 0-30; higher indicates higher severity.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 6 months after VP shunt
secondary_outcome.description: 10 meters walking test were evaluated of iNPH patients.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline at 6 months after VP shunt
secondary_outcome.description: A score for functional neurological status ; range 0-5; higher indicates higher severity.

intervention.description: A ventriculoperitoneal shunt is a tube that drains excess cerebrospinal fluid into abdomen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age â‰¥ 60 years;
- Diagnosis of iNPH based on clinical assessment
- Participant is able to give written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Combining AD and Parkinson's disease and other nervous system diseases
- Participant is not medically available for shunt surgery
- Secondary NPH

overall_official.affiliation: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

facility.name: The second affliated hospital of zhejiang university
